title: Who at riot can I contact for ping issues?
body:
Hey there!
Around sometime this summer, during one of the patches my ping has gone from a constant 23, to around 77 ping. I live a couple hours away from the servers, so my ping shouldn't be that high. I recently had to start using a program that I don't want to advertise, but anyways all it does is chooses a optimal path for my network connection, and now I'm at a stable 23 ping again. The problem is this program costs money, and has some inconvenient problems.
I called my ISP and the person at the desk doesn't have the technical knowledge to understand hops and all that good stuff, so I was wondering who at riot can I contact (and how) to get them in communication with my ISP so that my network route can become optimal again? I really feel like this could help other users who could be experiencing similar issues.
TLDR: Who at riot can I contact to put them in communication with my ISP to get my connection optimized

replies.body:
We can't speak to your ISP on your behalf, but we can certainly help you gather the right data and provide the right context to a tech at your ISP so your issue should be resolved. The first thing we need to do is have you disable the VPN you're using to reroute your connection. After you've disabled your VPN, you can run some traceroutes using [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/) to get a good look at your network routing. After loading up the app, simply plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field and start the trace. After 5 minutes has gone by, export the results of your trace as text and paste them in a reply to me.

Please let me know if you ran into any issues with those steps.

You're right, it looks like your route is fine up until the **ae-2-3615.ear2.Chicago2.Level3.net** node, where 99% of your packets drop off before reaching our servers. Level 3 is the operator of this node and they're a backbone network provider that your ISP partners with to get your connection to our servers. I'd strongly recommend providing this log to a tier 2 technical agent or supervisor at your ISP and let them know the symptoms you're seeing. This should be more than enough data to launch an investigation and work towards resolving this.

I hope that all makes sense and help you get this fixed up once and for all. If not, please let me know what you're confused with and I'll do my best to explain it in more depth. ( ^_^)／

He said they've been getting a large amount of complaints due to the Level 3 node, but he said he doubts anything is going to be done, simple because the two level 3 providers they partnered with have recently been bought out and he has seen a large difference in performance (he called them trash xD) but yeah I don't really know what to do, didn't sound too assuring. Thank you for your help though targon!

Ouch, I'm sorry to hear your ISP has had a lot of reports of issues with those Level 3 nodes. I hope those tier 2 agents are able to reach out to Level 3 and sort this out for good!

Anyway, I'm glad it's being looked into, at the very least. Don't hesitate to hit us up again if you need any other assistance.
